message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LO, cs.PL, cs.SE, cs.LG. 

The paper introduces a methodology for debugging answer-set programming (ASP) and discusses the implementation of this methodology in an integrated development environment for ASP. ASP is a subfield of artificial intelligence (AI) that deals with declarative problem solving, which suggests that cs.AI is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the formal basis for stepping and the use of abstract constraints, which are topics related to logic and computation (cs.LO) and programming languages (cs.PL). The paper also touches on methodological aspects and the embedding of stepping in the ASP development process, which suggests that it may be relevant to software engineering (cs.SE). Finally, the paper discusses the detection of bugs and the use of different solver languages, which are topics related to machine learning (cs.LG).
